Idiom (Aja): Ato kplé ɖo ɖé wé wé.
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: Fixed clause; subject + verb + adverb repetition for emphasis.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To act without thinking or to rush into action.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Act quickly without considering the consequences.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Derived from hunting traditions where impulsive action could ruin a chase.
First Example Sentence: Mi nyi bé é kpo ɖo to la, ato kplé ɖo ɖé wé wé!
Second Example Sentence: Afi la ma gbe bé ato kplé ɖo ɖé wé wé le nu la.
Third Example Sentence: Nu ɖo to la ma kpɔ yi gbe bé ato kplé ɖo ɖé wé wé.

Idiom (Aja): Aví ɖe nyo ɖe gbe ɖe.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Everything is going well or smoothly.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Things are fine or progressing well.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common in Aja greetings expressing well-being.
First Example Sentence: Mi bé aví ɖe nyo ɖe gbe ɖe, e bé o?
Second Example Sentence: É bé é ma nyi bé aví ɖe nyo ɖe gbe ɖe.
Third Example Sentence: Agbè la ma kpo bé aví ɖe nyo ɖe gbe ɖe le nu la.

Idiom (Aja): Nu ɖo to wéma bé zɔ wé nu la.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Things are getting worse or deteriorating.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Used in community discourse to express concern over decline.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aja): [nù ɖótó wémá bé zɔ wé nù là]
First Example Sentence: Nu ɖo to wéma bé zɔ wé nu la, agbè le kpɔ yi gbe.
Second Example Sentence: É nyi bé nu ɖo to wéma bé zɔ wé nu la le wéma gbe.
Third Example Sentence: Mi bé nu ɖo to wéma bé zɔ wé nu la le ɖo to gbe.

Idiom (Aja): Agbè la ɖo ɖé gbé yi.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To live a good and honorable life.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Reflects Aja values around ethical living.
First Example Sentence: Agbè la ɖo ɖé gbé yi bé é le gbe bé nu la kpɔ yi.
Second Example Sentence: É ma kpɔ yi gbe bé agbè la ɖo ɖé gbé yi.
Third Example Sentence: Mi nyi bé agbè la ɖo ɖé gbé yi le nu la.

Idiom (Aja): Aɖevi la wéma bé yi ɖe ɖo to gbe.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: The child behaves like their parent.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Common family saying denoting inherited traits.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aja): [àɖèvì là wémá bé jì ɖè ɖótó gbè]
First Example Sentence: Aɖevi la wéma bé yi ɖe ɖo to gbe, agbè kpɔ bé é ma gbe.
Second Example Sentence: Mi nyi bé aɖevi la wéma bé yi ɖe ɖo to gbe.
Third Example Sentence: É le gbe bé aɖevi la wéma bé yi ɖe ɖo to gbe.

Idiom (Aja): Nu kpɔ ɖé do yi wéma.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Good things come to those who wait.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Used widely in Aja oral traditions emphasizing patience.
First Example Sentence: Nu kpɔ ɖé do yi wéma, mi ma gbe bé nu kpɔ la kpɔ yi.
Second Example Sentence: É bé nu kpɔ ɖé do yi wéma bé é ma gbe.
Third Example Sentence: Agbè la kpɔ yi gbe bé nu kpɔ ɖé do yi wéma.

Idiom (Aja): Kpɔ agbè la ɖe ɖo to gbe.
First Example Sentence: Mi nyi bé kpɔ agbè la ɖe ɖo to gbe le nu la.
Second Example Sentence: É ma kpɔ yi gbe bé kpɔ agbè la ɖe ɖo to gbe.
Third Example Sentence: Afi la kpɔ bé kpɔ agbè la ɖe ɖo to gbe.

Idiom (Aja): Nu nyi bé agbè la wé ɖe.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Rooted in Aja moral philosophy valuing integrity.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aja): [nù njì bé àgbɛ là wé ɖè]
First Example Sentence: Mi nyi bé nu nyi bé agbè la wé ɖe le nu la.
Second Example Sentence: É kpɔ bé nu nyi bé agbè la wé ɖe kpɔ yi gbe.
Third Example Sentence: Afi la gbe bé nu nyi bé agbè la wé ɖe kpɔ yi.

Idiom (Aja): Nu la ma gbe bé kɔ wéma.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aja): [nù là má gbè bé kɔ wémá]
First Example Sentence: Nu la ma gbe bé kɔ wéma, mi kpɔ bé é ma gbe.
Second Example Sentence: É bé nu la ma gbe bé kɔ wéma le nu la.
Third Example Sentence: Agbè kpɔ yi gbe bé nu la ma gbe bé kɔ wéma.

Idiom (Aja): Mi ma yi wéma bé agbè kpɔ yi gbe.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Reflects Aja emphasis on diligence and persistence.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aja): [mí má jì wémá bé àgbɛ kpɔ jì gbè]
First Example Sentence: Mi ma yi wéma bé agbè kpɔ yi gbe, é ma kpɔ yi gbe.
Second Example Sentence: É nyi bé mi ma yi wéma bé agbè kpɔ yi gbe.
Third Example Sentence: Mi kpɔ yi gbe bé mi ma yi wéma bé agbè kpɔ yi gbe.
